name: College of Alice & Peter Tan (CAPT)
description: A Residential College in UTown with a strong focus on active citizenship and community engagement. Known for its formal dinners and social causes.

name: Tembusu College
description: One of the first RCs in UTown, known for its 'Home of Possibilities' motto and frequent Rector's Teas with distinguished guests.

name: Residential College 4 (RC4)
description: Located in UTown, RC4 focuses on systems thinking and sustainable healthcare. It has a close-knit community vibe.

name: Acacia College
description: Acacia College’s two-year residency brings together undergraduates from diverse disciplines to explore AI’s impact on society. Through small-group classes, hands-on learning, and student-led activities, students will examine AI’s ethical and cultural implications while building practical skills in Generative AI, AI programming, and Machine Learning. These courses go hand-in-hand with the College’s residential programme, experiential learning opportunities, and student-led activities.

name: UTown Residence
description: Apartment-style living in UTown, primarily for graduate students and undergraduates on exchange. Independent living without a meal plan.

name: Eusoff Hall
description: Located near the Faculty of Engineering. Famous for its yellow spirit, excellence in sports, and strong hall heritage.

name: Temasek Hall
description: Adjacent to Eusoff Hall. Known for its white identity, strong sporting culture, and friendly rivalry with Eusoff.

name: Raffles Hall
description: Centrally located near the Museum and YIH. Known for its rich history and heavy involvement in arts and culture productions.

name: Kent Ridge Hall
description: Located near the Business School. Known for its vibrant hall life, media productions, and strong float building culture.

name: Sheares Hall
description: Situated near the Business School. Famous for its orange family culture, strong band/music groups, and tight-knit community.

name: King Edward VII Hall (KE7)
description: The oldest hall in NUS, located near the School of Medicine. It has a rich heritage and a balanced focus on sports and culture.

name: Prince George's Park Residences (PGPR)
description: A massive residential complex at the southern end of campus. Best for independent living, with its own canteens and gym.

name: Ridge View Residential College (RVRC)
description: Located in the heart of Kent Ridge near University Hall. It focuses on sustainability, outdoor education, and workplace readiness.

name: Helix House
description: One of the newer Houses in the PGP area. Offers a balance between hall life and residence privacy with community events.

name: LightHouse
description: A House located within the PGP precinct. Focuses on leadership and creating a supportive 'beacon' for student life.

name: Pioneer House
description: Located in PGP, Pioneer House emphasizes innovation and trying new things. It has a startup-like culture.
